info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued March 26 at 4:59AM AKDT until March 26 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the High Wind Watch, northeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible.
* WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau.
* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon for the High Wind Watch. Through 10 AM for the Dense Fog Advisory.
* IMPACTS...High winds could blow around unsecured objects, damage property and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions look favorable for strong winds in the Downtown Juneau area starting Wednesday evening and persisting through Thursday. Confidence is high for the potential of wind gusts between 40 and 50 mph. The potential for wind gusts up to 60 mph is there but confidence is not as high at this time, but the threat remains and will need to be monitored as things get closer.
info.instruction:
People are urged to secure vessels and loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind.
If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

parameter.value: DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON
